intro: Gynoxys ignaciana, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars, which bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has simple, opposite, ovate leaves that are dark green and glossy in appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Gynoxys ignaciana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
